nodes.bodyText:
Can't this just be...
boolean isDelete = metadata.isDeleted().booleanValue();
Unfortunately not, isDeleted() returns an @Nullable Boolean. Boolean.TRUE.equals(null) will eval to false.
Same deal. There are three possibilities, null, true, false. I only want to catch one of these, in a null-safe way.

Objects.nonNull is for API >= 24, but otherwise could also write this like:
    .filter(Objects::nonNull)
    .filter(Boolean.TRUE::equals)

Would probably do something like that on the backend with the Java8 stream APIs (similar to Rx filter.)
